title: the_amazing_world_of_gumball
body:
[b]The Amazing World of Gumball[/b] is a British-American animated children's television series created by Ben Bocquelet for [[Cartoon Network]]. Produced primarily by Cartoon Network Development Studio Europe, the series first aired on May 3, 2011, and is rated TV-Y7-FV.

h4. See Also:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Amazing_World_of_Gumball

body: Name used by two separate manga. See [[koharu_biyori_(mizuki_takehito)]] or [[koharu_biyori_(manga_time_kirara)]].

title: shell_to_ear
body: A character is holding a [[seashell]] to their ear. It's said that if you do this, you can hear the ocean.

title: list_of_sfx:z
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "SFX":#dtext-sfx
** "za":#dtext-za
** "zu":#dtext-zu
** "ze":#dtext-ze
** "zo":#dtext-zo
* 2. "See also":#dtext-see-also
[/expand]

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#za.za:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]za[/td]
[td]ザ[/td]
[td]ざ[/td]
[td]*whoosh*
*fwuush*
*fwiishh*[/td]
[td]Strong, energetic movement.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]za[/td]
[td]ザッ[/td]
[td]ざっ[/td]
[td](1) *thud* *slide*;
(2) *footstep on grass* *walking quickly* *running through grass/bushes*;
(3) *white noise*;
(4) *knock* *swipe*;
(5) *shwipp*;
(6) *stand*;
(7) *rush* *dash*;
(8) *rustle*;
(9) *push* *shove* *blocks*;
(10) *skuff*;
(11) *turn* *whirls around*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for when one slides their shoes on gravel or grass; expresses the existence of that character; sound of people/person walking;
(3) Generic white noise sound, can be TV static, etc;
(4) SFX for when knocking things off a table with your arm;
(5) SFX for sudden, swift, deadly, and/or covert movement;
(6) Instead of just *white noise*;
(9) SFX for stepping over something or someone protectively, and pushing it/them back.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]za za[/td]
[td]ザザ[/td]
[td]ざざ[/td]
[td]*rustling* *woosh* *whoosh*[/td]
[td]Ex. Wind rustling in leaves, grass.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]za-[/td]
[td]ザー[/td]
[td]ざー[/td]
[td](1) *vssshh* *raining*;
(2) *rustle*;
(3) *sliide* *slip*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for water; usually heavy rain or an aggressive flow of water.  Softer sound than *zaa*, which can also be rain; louder rain than *saa*;
(2) Rustling of cloth, clothing, usually for appearance of a character;
(3) SFX for a sliding motion[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]za- za-[/td]
[td]ザーザー[/td]
[td]ざーざー[/td]
[td]*rustling*[/td]
[td]Ex. Wind rustling in leaves, grass.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zaa[/td]
[td]ザァァ[/td]
[td]ざぁぁ[/td]
[td](1) *rain* *sss*
*raining*
*pouring*;
(2) *fwoosh* *woosh* *whoosh*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for the hiss of heavy rainfall, stronger sound than *za-*;
(2) SFX for a strong gust of wind[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zaba[/td]
[td]ザバ[/td]
[td]ざば[/td]
[td](1) *big splash*;
(2) *splatter*[/td]
[td](1) Big splash, usually with water overflowing.  See also *jabon*, *shapu*.  
See *bashan*, *picha*, and *pisha* for smaller splashes;
(2) SFX for a splashing, messy effect[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zabu[/td]
[td]ザブ[/td]
[td]ざぶ[/td]
[td](1) *big splash*;
(2) *whap* *thwap*[/td]
[td](1) See also *jabon* and *shapu*.
See also *bashan*, *picha*, and *pisha* for smaller splashes.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zabu zabu[/td]
[td]ザブザブ[/td]
[td]ざぶざぶ[/td]
[td]*wash wash* *swish swosh*[/td]
[td]Like at a river.  Notion that you are hand-washing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zabun[/td]
[td]ザブン[/td]
[td]ざぶん[/td]
[td]*big splash*[/td]
[td]See also *jabon* and *shapu*.
See also *bashan*, *picha*, and *pisha* for smaller splashes.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zaka zaka[/td]
[td]ザカザカ[/td]
[td]ざかざか[/td]
[td]*thud thud thud* *stride stride*[/td]
[td]SFX for short, purposeful footsteps.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zakku zakku[/td]
[td]ザックザック[/td]
[td]ざっくざっく[/td]
[td]*snip snip* *cut cut*[/td]
[td]SFX for cutting something, like scissors used to cut hair.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zaku[/td]
[td]ザク[/td]
[td]ざく[/td]
[td](1) *stab*;
(2) *thunk*;
(3) *mutter* *chatter* *murmur* *buzz*[/td]
[td](1) Usually a deep stab, with a knife.  See also ブス (Busu).  Can also be a mental stab;
(3) Sound of a crowd of people, background chatter noise.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zaku zaku[/td]
[td]ザクザク[/td]
[td]ざくざく[/td]
[td](1) *cut*;
(2) *cut* *stab stab*[/td]
[td](1) Cutting a thick and heavy object.  See also *saku saku*;
(2) SFX for multiple, deep stabs.  Can also be mental stabs, i.e. when cutting remarks are made.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zan[/td]
[td]ザン[/td]
[td]ざん[/td]
[td](1) *tumble* *fall*;
(2) *slash*;
(3) *fwump* *lifts* *carries*[/td]
[td](2) Like with a knife or sword in an aggressive manner;
(3) SFX for suddenly lifting and carrying something heavy, like a muffled grunt[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zan[/td]
[td]ザンッ[/td]
[td]ざんっ[/td]
[td](1) *tumble* *fall*
*lands* *fwump*;
(2) *slash*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for hitting the ground in fight, like in a roll or dive move;
(2) Like the slash of a sword.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zanbu[/td]
[td]ザンブ[/td]
[td]ざんぶ[/td]
[td](1) *plunge* *dunk* *ga-dunk*;
(2) *plunge* *splash*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for something big or heavy plunging into water;
(2) SFX for plunging something into water[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zanburi[/td]
[td]ザンブリ[/td]
[td]ざんぶり[/td]
[td](1) *plunge* *ga-dunk* *dunk*;
(2) *splash*;
(3) *crash*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for something big, heavy, and bulky plunging into water;
(2) SFX for something falling into water;
(3) SFX for something falling into water, emphasis on the impact[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zappa-n[/td]
[td]ザッパーン[/td]
[td]ざっぱーん[/td]
[td](1) *spla---sh*;
(2) *va-vwooosh*
*woosh*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for a big splash, notion that there is a big wave after the splash;
(2) SFX for a very large body of water making impact, such as a tsunami wave[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zara[/td]
[td]ザラッ[/td]
[td]ざらっ[/td]
[td](1) *rough* *coarse*;
(2) *granular* *crumbling*;
(3) *coarse* *sandy* *gritty*;
(4) *everything* *thrown together* *dump* *toss*[/td]
[td](4) SFX for a bunch of stuff mixed together that has a lot of texture and/or variety.  
Ex: Stir-fry veggies where you mix "everything but the kitchen sink".[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zara zara[/td]
[td]ザラザラ[/td]
[td]ざらざら[/td]
[td]*rough* *bumpy* *sandy*[/td]
[td]SFX for a rough texture; opposite to サラサラ (Sara sara).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zasha-[/td]
[td]ザシャーッ[/td]
[td]ざしゃーっ[/td]
[td]*fushaa* *shaa*[/td]
[td]SFX for something sliding, like landing on sand and trying to stop.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zashi[/td]
[td]ザシ[/td]
[td]ざし[/td]
[td]*lash* *slash*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zashu[/td]
[td]ザシュ[/td]
[td]ざしゅ[/td]
[td]*slash*[/td]
[td]Usually with a sword.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zatto[/td]
[td]ザット[/td]
[td]ざっと[/td]
[td](1) *quickly*
*roughly*;
(2) *cursory*
*briefly*
[/td]
[td](1) To do something fast because they might be impatient or out of time;
(2) To give something only a moment of attention, Ex: glance at the newspaper, skim through notes quickly.
See also *satto*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zawa[/td]
[td]ザワッ[/td]
[td]ざわっ[/td]
[td](1) *shine*;
(2) *wrap*[/td]
[td](1) To light up or shine when you see someone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zawa[/td]
[td]ザワ[/td]
[td]ざわ[/td]
[td](1) *rustle*;
(2) *crowd noise* *chatter* *buzz*[/td]
[td](1) May be specific to plants.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zawa zawa[/td]
[td]ザワザワ[/td]
[td]ざわざわ[/td]
[td](1) *chatter chatter* 
*buzz* 
*jabber jabber*;
(2) *rustle rustle*;
(3) *mutter mutter*
*buzz buzz*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for liveliness, noise, crowd like ガヤガヤ (Gaya gaya);
(2) SFX for the leaves of a forest moving.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zaza-n[/td]
[td]ザザーン[/td]
[td]ざざーん[/td]
[td]*sha-shaaa*
*shaa*[/td]
[td]SFX for calm waves of water.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zazaza[/td]
[td]ザザザ[/td]
[td]ざざざ[/td]
[td](1) *footstep in grass* 
*walk quickly* 
*running through grass*;
(2) *vssshhhaaaa*
*vvssshhh*;
(3) *run run run*[/td]
[td](1) Running through grass or bushes;
(2) A "fwishing" kind of sound, can be grassy or liquid-like;
(3) SFX for several quick footsteps, like when running away from something or charging towards something.
See also *zuzaza* (ズザザ).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zazaza[/td]
[td]ザザザッ[/td]
[td]ざざざっ[/td]
[td](1) *dash*;
(2) *slide*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for a quick motion, such as when one runs or races for something;
(2) SFX for a quick and smooth motion, for swiftness[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zazza[/td]
[td]ザッザッ[/td]
[td]ざっざっ[/td]
[td]*rustling* *footsteps* *marching* *ka-chink ka-chink* *thud thud* *fwsshhh shaa*[/td]
[td]Rustling sound of many footsteps trying to be stealthy.  See also *zazaza*.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#zu.zu:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]zu[/td]
[td]ズ[/td]
[td]ず[/td]
[td]*vigorous motion*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zu[/td]
[td]ズッ[/td]
[td]ずっ[/td]
[td](1) *slurp*; 
(2) *slip* *slide*;
(3) *drool* *flow*;
(4) *slump*;
(5) *slow* *deadly* *smooth* *calm*[/td]
[td](1) See also *zuzu*;
(2) Falling motion.  See also *zuzu*;
(3) Drool or other liquid flowing;
(4) Falling motion, faint;
(5) SFX for a slow maneuver, usually to emphasize and dramatize something deadly or of high importance/impact about to happen[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zu zu[/td]
[td]ズズ[/td]
[td]ずず[/td]
[td]*sip*[/td]
[td]See also *zuru*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zu-[/td]
[td]ズー[/td]
[td]ずー[/td]
[td](1) *disappointed* *sad*;
(2) *drag* *sink* *slump*[/td]
[td](1) Often describes things sinking, can mean a "sinking" heart;
(2) Motion occurring in a depressed context.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zu-n[/td]
[td]ズーン[/td]
[td]ずーん[/td]
[td](1) *zoomed*; 
(2) *doomed*;
(3) *disappointed* 
*sad*;
(4) *gloom*;
(5) *ache* *throb*[/td]
[td](1) When something tremendously enormous stands in the way and one cannot get through; 
(2) The weight which drops on one's shoulders when something disappointing happens or when incredibly worried;
(3) Often describes things sinking, can mean a "sinking" heart;
(5) SFX for pain, such as a headache.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zua[/td]
[td]ズアッ[/td]
[td]ずあっ[/td]
[td]*shwip* *fwish*[/td]
[td]SFX for a *whoosh* type of intangible effect.  Can be thought of as a whirl of momentum (or *sudden momentum*).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuba[/td]
[td]ズバッ[/td]
[td]ずばっ[/td]
[td](1) *slash*; 
(2) *bluntly said*[/td]
[td](1) A slice or cut with a single blow, see also *supa*;
(2) Used when someone says something very directly to someone else.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zubari[/td]
[td]ズバリ[/td]
[td]ずばり[/td]
[td]*slash* *slice* *cut*[/td]
[td]To slice or cut with a single blow, see also *supa*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zubi zubi[/td]
[td]ズビズビ[/td]
[td]ずびずび[/td]
[td]*sniff sniff*[/td]
[td]Sound of a runny nose during a cold.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zubibi[/td]
[td]ズビビ[/td]
[td]ずびび[/td]
[td]*sob sob*
*hic hic*
*cry cry*
*drop drop*[/td]
[td]SFX for sobbing or crying, or tears dropping down one's face as they're crying.
See also *zubi zubi*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zubishi[/td]
[td]ズビシッ[/td]
[td]ずびしっ[/td]
[td]*ker-smack*
*ka-pow*[/td]
[td]SFX for a smooth, deadly, vigorous movement.  Combination of *zu* and *bishi*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zubo[/td]
[td]ズボッ[/td]
[td]ずぼっ[/td]
[td]*jams in* *jam* *crush* *ram*[/td]
[td]SFX for jamming something inside of something else, like an arm into a vending machine.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuchu[/td]
[td]ズチュッ[/td]
[td]ずちゅっ[/td]
[td](1) *gsh*;
(2) *schlip*;
(3) *squish*[/td]
[td](1) A splatter SFX;
(2) Something slippery;
(3) Something slippery[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zudada[/td]
[td]ズダダ[/td]
[td]ずだだ[/td]
[td]*slip-slide* 
*slip n slide*
*slip* *crash* *fall*
*tumble*[/td]
[td]A combination of SFX's for slipping and falling in and around the same time.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zudon[/td]
[td]ズドン[/td]
[td]ずどん[/td]
[td]*thud* *bam*[/td]
[td]SFX for a heavy thud.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zugagaga[/td]
[td]ズガガガ[/td]
[td]ずががが[/td]
[td]*menace*[/td]
[td]Combination of vigorous action and menace, loud drastic things happening.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zugen[/td]
[td]ズゲン[/td]
[td]ずげん[/td]
[td]*vroom* *vroo-vroom* *zoom*[/td]
[td]SFX for the revving of an engine as it zips by at high speeds, almost like when it hits the "whining" stage because it's so fast.  Higher-pitched than a rumbling sound.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zugogogo[/td]
[td]ズゴゴゴ[/td]
[td]ずごごご[/td]
[td]*menace*[/td]
[td]Combination of vigorous action and menace, loud drastic things happening.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zui[/td]
[td]ズイッ[/td]
[td]ずいっ[/td]
[td](1) *stare* *intense* *serious*;
(2) *thrust* *slide* *hands*;
(3) *thrust* *shove* *push*[/td]
[td](1) To look at someone or something intensely;
(2) SFX for handing something over to another person, in an almost surprising or sudden manner (like a 'tah-dah' moment);
(3) SFX for roughly handing something over[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuki[/td]
[td]ズキ[/td]
[td]ずき[/td]
[td]*sharp pain*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuki zuki[/td]
[td]ズキズキ[/td]
[td]ずきずき[/td]
[td]*throb throb*[/td]
[td]Can be mental or physical.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zukin[/td]
[td]ズキン[/td]
[td]ずきん[/td]
[td]*throb* *sting*[/td]
[td]Can be mental or physical pain.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zukin zukin[/td]
[td]ズキンズキン[/td]
[td]ずきんずきん[/td]
[td]*throb throb* 
*sting sting*[/td]
[td]SFX for pain.  Slightly heavier than *zuki zuki,* usually more of a physical throb than a mental one.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuku[/td]
[td]ズクッ[/td]
[td]ずくっ[/td]
[td]*bam* *ka-boom* *ka-bam* *boom* *blam*[/td]
[td]Sound of an explosion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zumo[/td]
[td]ズモ[/td]
[td]ずも[/td]
[td]*menace* *looming*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zumomomo[/td]
[td]ズモモモ[/td]
[td]ずももも[/td]
[td]*menace* *looming*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zun[/td]
[td]ズン[/td]
[td]ずん[/td]
[td](1) *vigorous motion*;
(2) *thump*[/td]
[td](2) Like thumping of strings on string instrument (staccato).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zun zun[/td]
[td]ズンズン[/td]
[td]ずんずん[/td]
[td](1) *thud thud thud*[/td]
[td](1) When one walks very fast ahead; 
(2) Very vigorous motion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zunguri[/td]
[td]ズングリ[/td]
[td]ずんぐり[/td]
[td]*chubby* *big* *dumpy*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zupo[/td]
[td]ズポッ[/td]
[td]ずぽっ[/td]
[td]*zwp*
*falls*[/td]
[td]SFX for someone or something suddenly falling into a hole.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zurari[/td]
[td]ズラリ[/td]
[td]ずらり[/td]
[td](1) *next to*
*alongside*
*beside*
*side by side*;
(2) *parallel*
*aligned*
straight beside*[/td]
[td](1) Ex: a row of products displayed behind a store window;
(2) Ex: parking a car next to another car, parallel to each other.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuri[/td]
[td]ズリ[/td]
[td]ずり[/td]
[td](1) *stagger*; 
(2) *fall back in shock* *slip*[/td]
[td](1) Stagger when walking;
(2) See also *gura*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuri zuri[/td]
[td]ズリズリ[/td]
[td]ずりずり[/td]
[td]*drag*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuriri[/td]
[td]ズリリ[/td]
[td]ずりり[/td]
[td](1) *stagger*; 
(2) *fall back in shock*[/td]
[td](1) Stagger when walking;
(2) See also *gura*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuru[/td]
[td]ズル[/td]
[td]ずる[/td]
[td](1) *slip*; 
(2) *sip* *slurp*;
(3) *drag* *pull*;
(4) *stagger*;
(5) *fall back in shock*;
(6) *strong movement*;
(7) *being slipped*[/td]
[td](1) Something slipping out of place physically or consciously;
(2) See also *zuzu*;
(3) Something heavy dragging or being pulled;
(4) Stagger when walking;
(6) More vigorous than *suru*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuru[/td]
[td]ズルッ[/td]
[td]ずるっ[/td]
[td](1) *slip*;
(2) *drag* *slide*;
(3) *slurp*[/td]
[td](2) SFX for pulling, pushing, or rubbing something along the surface of the floor;
(3) SFX for slurping a straw.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuru zuru[/td]
[td]ズルズル[/td]
[td]ずるずる[/td]
[td](1) *drag*;
(2) *freely*
*loosely*
*wherever*
*dally*
*without a care*;
(3) *slurp slurp*;
(4) *slip slide*[/td]
[td](1) Something heavy dragging or being pulled;
(2) Ex: a cold runny nose running freely, or eating soup noisily and without care for the surroundings;
(3) SFX for a sucking or slurping motion, like when eating noodles very fast[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zururu[/td]
[td]ズルル[/td]
[td]ずるる[/td]
[td]*slurp*[/td]
[td]See *jururu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zusasa[/td]
[td]ズササ[/td]
[td]ずささ[/td]
[td]*quick vigorous motion* *scuttle*[/td]
[td]*zu* (vigorous) plus *sasa* *quick motion*; a quick scuttling recoil.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zusha[/td]
[td]ズシャ[/td]
[td]ずしゃ[/td]
[td](1) *slide*; 
(2) *slash*[/td]
[td](1) Sound of something sliding; 
(2) Someone slashing another with a sword, or whip-like motion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zushin[/td]
[td]ズシン[/td]
[td]ずしん[/td]
[td]*shud*[/td]
[td]Hard impact, harder than *dosun* or *patan*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuta zuta[/td]
[td]ズタズタ[/td]
[td]ずたずた[/td]
[td]*torn to bits* *worn out* *total wreck*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuttan[/td]
[td]ズッタン[/td]
[td]ずったん[/td]
[td]*left right*
*back and forth*
*in and out*
*dancing*[/td]
[td]Movement for dancing or jamming to the beat of some music.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuun[/td]
[td]ズウン[/td]
[td]ずうん[/td]
[td](1) *zziipp* *slash*;
(2) *jab* *stab* *slash*;
(3) *bam*;
(4) *doom* *gloom*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for a direct hit, usually with a whip-like tool or weapon;
(2) SFX for a direct hit, usually with a whip-like tool or weapon;
(3) SFX for a direct hit, usually with a whip-like tool or weapon;
(4) SFX for depression.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuva[/td]
[td]ズヴァ[/td]
[td]ずゔぁ[/td]
[td]*slash* *shaa* *fushaa*[/td]
[td]SFX for getting cut or sliced, and bleeding profusely.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuyo-n[/td]
[td]ズヨーン[/td]
[td]ずよーん[/td]
[td]*goom* *depressed*[/td]
[td]SFX for getting extremely upset or a feeling of doom sets in.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]zuza[/td]
[td]ズザッ[/td]
[td]ずざっ[/td]
[td](1) *squeal* *skree* *screech*;
(2) *skid*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for the squealing of tires;
(2) SFX for something struggling for traction, such as when jamming on the brakes of a car[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]ずざざ[/td]
[td](1) *fwwshhh*
*vssshhh*
*rrruummmbleee*;
(2) *sliiide* *fall* *tumble*[/td]

See also *zazaza* (ザザザ);

[td]zuzo[/td]

[td](1) *slurp*;
(2) *slip*[/td]

[td]zuzo-[/td]

title: chiaroscuro
body:
[i]Chiaroscuro[/i] is a term from art theory referring to the use of strong contrasts between light and dark across an entire composition to achieve a sense of volume in modeling three-dimensional objects. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chiaroscuro":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiaroscuro]

h4. See also

* [[tenebrism]]

title: moon_rabbit
body:
Folktale about a [[rabbit]] on the [[moon]] pounding [[mochi]].

In Japanese culture, instead of seeing "the man on the moon" it is said that there is a rabbit pounding [[mochi]]. In Chinese folktale, "Jade rabbit" makes the elixir of immortality on the moon.

h4. See also

* [[moon]]
* [[mochi]]
* [[mallet]]
* [[mortar (bowl)|]]
* [[mochitsuki]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Moon rabbit":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_rabbit

title: takeya_yuki
body:
The main heroine of [[Gakkou Gurashi!]].  A bright and cheerful teen who really loves her school and club. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[pink hair]], and typically wears a [[school uniform]] with an [[animal hat]] and [[winged bag]]. Several [[hairclip]]s adorn her hair, with one of them having a teddy bear's face on it.

[spoiler]Revealed at the start that she's suffering from psychosis and still views the world as it was before the zombie outbreak.[/spoiler]

title: q.e.d.
body:
Q.E.D. 証明終了 (Q.E.D. Shomei Shuuryou) is a detective manga by Motohiro Katou. The main character Sou Touma encounters a variety of mystery cases. Sou often works in tandem with his friend and potential love interest Kana, with him supplying the brain while she acts as brawn.

In 2009, the manga won the Kodansha Manga Award for the shōnen category, sold over a total of 3 millions copies and adapted as a live-action TV series.

h4. Characters

* [[Touma Sou]]
* [[Mizuhara Kana]]
* [[Mizuhara Koutarou]]

title: ebisu_eika
body: Stillborn Idol of the Riverbed The first stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a stillborn infant's spirit who has become a god of fortune and is the leader of other stillborn spirits. Her ability is to stack and balance [[stone|stones]] well, and she can also turn other otherwise mundane tasks into fun. She has [[grey hair]] and [[long earlobes]]. She has a matching [[skirt set]] resembling a jellyfish, and is [[barefoot|barefooted]]. Notably, she is one of the few characters in the series without a hat or head ornament. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Eika Ebisu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Eika_Ebisu

body:

title: smokescreen_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Smokescreen[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a blue and red 1979 Nissan Fairlady Z (Datsun 280ZX) race [[car]].

Motto: [i]"A look can be deceiving; a touch can be lethal...!!!".[/i]

title: h&k_sl8
body:
The [[Heckler & Koch]] [b]SL8[/b] is a German semi-automatic [b][[rifle]][/b], available in both .223 Remington or 5.56×45mm NATO [[ammunition|cartridge]]. It is the civilian version of the [[H&K G36|G36]]. The pistol grip and folding stock have been replaced by a fixed stock with a thumbhole. The receiver has also been modified to prevent the attachment of a folding stock.

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[SL8 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Heckler & Koch SL8":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_SL8]

title: yukari_(christmas)_(princess_connect!)
body:
[[Yukari (princess connect!)|]]'s [[official alternate costume|official]] christmas costume in [[Princess Connect!]].

She is a [[elf]] has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] stylized in a [[ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[fur-trimmed dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], [[blue gloves|blue]] [[fur-trimmed gloves]], a [[striped bow]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[flower earrings]].

h4. See Also

title: tang_wutong_(douluo_dalu)
body:
She is the daughter of [[Tang San]], and [[Xiao Wu (douluo dalu)|]] from [[Douluo Dalu]]. She the Heroine of Douluo Dalu, and the wife Huo Yuhao from Douluo Dalu 2. She takes the form of Wang Dong early in the story as she disguises as a male while she was young, and ultimately reveals her true form when they're older. She also has a Soul Fusion with Huyao where takes the form of the Goddess of Life who looks like a more mature version of Tang Wutong in white clothes.

Associated:
[[Wang Qiu er (douluo dalu)|]], She has a similar appearance as Tang Wutong as well having the powerful Golden Dragon Martial Soul granting her immense strength. She was also mistaken as a doppelganger, or a sibling do to the very close resemblance to her. Her true form is a Three Eyed Golden Lion who has traces of the Golden Dragon Bloodline, but is simulated by the God King, Tang San. She was created as a test by Tang San for Hu Yao's love for Tang Wutong.

title: gsh-18
body:
The [b]GSh-18[/b] is a Russian semi-automatic [b][[handgun|pistol]][/b] developed by "KBP Instrument Design Bureau":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KBP_Instrument_Design_Bureau] in the late 1990s. The pistol's name is derived from the initials of its designers, Gryazev and Shipunov, as well as the its standard [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] capacity of 18 rounds. 

The GSh-18 is a rotating-barrel, short-recoil, locked-breech pistol with 10 locking lugs spaced equally around the barrel. These lugs provide a large locking surface area, resulting in a strong lockup. While the GSh-18 can use standard 9×19mm Parabellum rounds, it was designed to use the higher-velocity, Russian [[body armor|armour]]-piercing 7N31 9×19mm [[ammunition|round]]. The pistol incorporates a pre-set striker, in a similar manner to the [[Glock]]. The frame is made of polymer. The GSh-18 pistol is of incredibly simple design and construction, containing only 17 total parts. 

h1. See also
* [[GSh-18 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "GSh-18":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GSh-18]

title: sbd_dauntless
body:
The Douglas SBD Dauntless was a World War II American naval scout plane and dive bomber. It was similar to the Aichi [[D3A]] but with greater bomb load and armor protection.

Generally rugged and reliable, it served alongside the [[TBF Avenger]] as the backbone of the American fleet air arm. The plane is best kown for sinking the four Japanese aircraft carriers at the [[Battle of Midway]].

The aircraft was designed by Ed Heinemann who would subsequently design the [[A-1 Skyraider]] and the [[A-4 Skyhawk]].

h4.See also

* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Douglas SBD Dauntless":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_SBD_Dauntless

title: rex_zero_1_(late_night_tea)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Rex Zero 1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s second skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Workplace Evolution' skin collection from 2022.

A [[business casual]] [[office lady]] attire. While elements such as her hat are discarded, others such as her [[black choker|black]] [[choker]] and [[necklace]] remain, further bolstered by new additions such as the [[dice hair ornament]] which adorn her [[low twintails]] and [[braid]], and her [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]]. For the core of her attire, she wears an [[bra peek|half]]-[[cleavage|unbuttoned]] [[red shirt]] with a [[lanyard]]ed [[ID card]], with a [[black jacket]] on [[jacket on shoulders|her shoulders]] (within which one can see her namesake handgun), along with an [[asymmetrical skirt|asymmetrical]] [[black skirt|black]] [[skirt suit|skirt]], covering far less of her left leg, highlighting her [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]]. With a few ornaments on her skirt and jacket, she tops this off with a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. With her, she carries two [[clipboard]]s under her shoulder, and two [[mug]]s filled with the skin's titular tea, freshly-brewed. Her damaged art has her having spilled the clipboards onto the floor, and dumping [[sugar cube]]s into her tea, as her shirt becomes unbuttoned and her [[blue bra]] becomes visible.

title: naca_duct
body:
An "NACA duct":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NACA_duct] is a distinctive style of low-drag air intake. It takes its name from the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics, a U.S. government agency founded in 1915 to... well... advise on aeronautics. (NACA evolved into NASA, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, in 1958.) Although originally developed for aircraft, NACA ducts have appeared on a number of automobiles and motorcycles designed in the 1970s and 1980s. Notable examples of NACA-duct-equipped cars include the [[Ferrari F40]] and [[Lamborghini Countach]]. Some of these ducts were functional air intakes, but others were merely cosmetic--meant to convey an impression that the vehicles were high-tech and high-performance, like jet aircraft.

As an aside, "NACA" is an initialism, not an acronym (that is, the letters are pronounced individually, not as a single word).

title: chall_acustica
body:
Main protagonist of [[Gundam 00P]]'s first season.

She was a Second Generation Gundam Meister and designated pilot of the [[Gundam Plutone]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. [spoilers]However, due to a catastrophic tragedy which involves the Gundam Plutone and claimed the lives of her fellow Meisters, [[Ruido Resonance]] and [[Marlene Vlady]], Chall's hair turned [[white hair|white]], and she gained a huge [[scar]] on her left body and left eye. She retained her new appearance when she returns in 00P second season and its sequel, [[Gundam 00F]]. [/spoilers]

She's voiced by [[Aida Rikako]] [spoilers](00P version) and [[Kaida Yuuko]] (00F version)[/spoilers] in [[SD Gundam G-Generation|SD Gundam G-Generation Cross Rays]].
other_names: シャル・アクスティカ

title: leorio_paladiknight
body:
One of the four main characters of [[Hunter x Hunter]].

Leorio is initially introduced as a very selfish narcissist who places great emphasis on material wealth. Despite his assertions that he is only after money, he eventually reveals to [[Kurapika]] that he lost a close friend to a debilitating illness and this inspired him to become a doctor and earn money in order to help the sick and poor. He believes that all things in the world (lives, dreams, etc.) can be bought and that becoming a Hunter will provide him with the necessary funds for his medical education. In the Hunter Exam, Leorio meets [[gon_freecss|Gon]], [[killua_zoldyck|Killua]] and [[Kurapika]], the other three main characters of the series.

h4. Appearance

Leorio is a tall, manly-looking, fairly [[toned]] young man with small [[brown eyes]], [[black hair]], and a [[spiked_hair|spiked]] crew cut. He typically wears a dark blue [[business suit]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and teashade [[glasses]].

Some of the characters such as Killua near at the beginning of the story mistake Leorio for an old man, but he is actually a lot younger than he looks, being a teenager at the start of the series.

h4. Voice actors

* [[Nobutoshi Canna]] (Pilot OVA)
* [[Gouda Hozumi]] (1999)
* [[Fujiwara Keiji]] (2011)
* [[Jonathan Love]] (1999, EN)
* [[Matthew Mercer]] (2011, EN)

h4. External links

* "Hunterpedia: Leorio Paradinight":http://hunterxhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Leorio_Paradinight
other_names: レオリオ=パラディナイト

title: kamen_victory
body:
A supporting character in the [[kamen america (comic)|Kamen America]] comic series and the fourth member of the Kamen Corps. Her real name is Sylvia Prestige. Her family owns an international outdoor shop, and she has been [[kamen america|Carly's]] rival since elementary school. This rivalry continued when Carly's old media relations company chose Sylvia to be Kamen U.N. after Carly cut ties with them. After settling their differences [spoilers]and the revelation that the Kamen U.N. armor was a fake made by [[Vermillion Masquerade]][/spoilers], Sylvia joined the Kamen Corps. Unlike the rest of the Kamen Corps, Sylvia does not have any powers since she was not struck by space debris. However, she can control a special-made armor created from chimeraton-imbued materials [spoilers]due to second-hand exposure to chimeratons in Vermillion Masquerade's mud[/spoilers]. Sylvia is motivated by a desire to help people. She is secretly an avid gamer.

Sylvia has [[purple eyes]] and long, platinum [[blonde hair]]. She usually wears a [[black hairband]] which she replaces with a [[red hairband]] when wearing her Kamen Victory armor.

title: lazy_susan
body:
A Lazy Susan (a.k.a. Sally Wagon, or Dragon Sally, or Downtrodden Sally or Lazy Zan-Zu) is a turntable tray placed on a [[table]] or countertop to aid in distributing food. They are usually circular and placed in the center of a circular table to share dishes easily among diners. They are common at Chinese restaurants due to the culture of sharing dishes.

title: your_present_is_me
body: When a character presents themself to another as a [[gift]], usually on a traditional gift-giving occasion (e.g., Christmas, Valentine's Day, or the receiving character's birthday). Often involves [[naked ribbon]] and/or the presented character being [[in box|in a box]]. Valentine's Day versions also tend to involve [[chocolate on body]]. The receiving character doesn't necessarily need to be shown, and if shown, may or may not be pleased.

title: ranni_the_witch
body:
[b]Ranni the Witch[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is a mysterious figure who first introduces herself as Renna. Upon meeting her again, she reveals her true name and recruits the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] in servitude, setting them off in search of a hidden treasure. Her other servants are [[Blaidd the Half-Wolf]], [[War Counselor Iji]], [[Preceptor Seluvis]], and [[Glintstone Dragon Adula]]. She is the [[family|daughter]] of [[rennala queen of the full moon|Rennala]] and [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon]].

Ranni wears a [[large hat|large]] [[witch hat]] with wiry, silver [[hat ornament|ornamentation]] resembling a [[wreath]], and a [[fur cloak]] or [[fur cape|cape]] over what appears to be a pale [[robe]] or [[dress]]. She has [[extra arms|four arms]] and her limbs are [[doll joints|visibly jointed]]. She has [[cracked_skin|cracks]] on the left side of her face. She also has a second, translucent [[extra faces|face]] (called her "spirit face") which is displaced to one side, such that its left eye overlaps with her physical face's right eye. It is rather subtle and many players and artists don't notice it at first.

She normally wears a plain, silver [[ring]] on the ring finger of one of her right hands.

h4. See also

* [[Miniature Ranni]]
* [spoilers][[Lunar Princess Ranni]][/spoilers]

title: mid-autumn_festival
body:
The Mid-Autumn Festival (simplified Chinese: 中秋节; traditional Chinese: 中秋節), also known as Moon Festival or Mooncake Festival, is a traditional Chinese festival celebrated by China and many East and Southeast Asian people under the influence of China. It is the second-most important holiday after Chinese New Year with a history dating back over 3,000 years, when the Emperor of China worshipped the moon for bountiful harvests.

h4. See also

* [[Chuseok]] [tn]Korean equivalent[/tn]
* [[Tsukimi]] [tn]Japanese equivalent[/tn]

body:
[b]Fusuma[/b] is a type of sliding panel in traditional [[east asian architecture|Japanese architecture]]. Unlike [[shouji]], they are fully opaque and do not have a visible wooden lattice. They usually have a circular handle, and can be either plain or decorated with [[tag group:image composition|traditional Japanese imagery and patterns.]]

title: ichigo_hitofuri
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character, designed by [[Kanameyura]]. The personification of the [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] "[i]Ichigo Hitofuri[/i]":http://meitou.info/index.php/一期一振. He is the older brother of the Awataguchi school swords, due to the fact that he was the only tachi ever forged by Awataguchi.

Originally named "Okatana Yoshimitsu" (御刀吉光), Ichigo Hitofuri once belonged to Toyotomi Hideyoshi. He ordered the blade to be shortened to match his rather short height. Ichigo Hitofuri was damaged in the summer of 1615 during the Siege of Osaka at Osaka Castle and then re-tempered by Yasutsugu under the order of Tokugawa Ieyasu. However, Ieyasu didn’t had the chance to use this sword because he was advised by the Priest Tenkai to avoid sending Hideyoshi’s swords (including Ichigo Hitofuri) to Edo. It has been an Imperial treasure since that time, alongside [[Tsurumaru Kuninaga]], [[Uguisumaru]] and [[Hirano Toushirou]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[aqua hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He wears [[white gloves]] and a [[military uniform]] with [[necktie]].

Ichigo has a polite and humble personality and is shown to be concerned with his brothers' well-being. However, it seems that he keeps things to himself, such as the fact that he's worried about losing his identity (since he was retempered in the past) and is secretly displeased about the Saniwa having so many swords. 

Fans enjoy portraying him as the big brother of the Awataguchi tantous, due to him being the biggest/tallest blade among Yoshimitsu's creations, not because he's the oldest among them. Either that, or he's presented as a foil to the prankster Tsurumaru.

Because of his in-game elder brother status, many of the swords tend to call him "Ichi-nii" (Big brother Ichi), which extends to his nickname outside the game as well.

title: adelaide_bluthausen

title: shinano_toushirou
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. The personification of the [[tantou]] "Shinano Toushirou" and one of the many tantous of the Awataguchi school swords.

He was named after its owner Nagai Naomasa, whose title was Shinano no Kami, one of Tokugawa Ieyasu's retainers. Before that, it was owned by Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

He has short [[red hair]] and [[green eyes]]. He wears [[black gloves]] and a [[military uniform]] with [[necktie]], [[shorts]] and [[thigh holster|thigh holsters]].

A haughty and spoiled child, Shinano prides himself of being a "treasured sword" and thinks himself to be superior to the rest of the Toushirou brothers. He often demands for the [[saniwa_(touken_ranbu)|Saniwa]]'s attention, asking for attention and/or physical contact. His catchphrase is "懐入っていい？ ([[futokoro haitte ii?|Can I stay close to you?]])". Because it literally has the meaning of "Can I be in your bosom?", it is sometimes jokingly referred to as a sexually suggestive phrase.

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]he isn't recognized by his former masters, but gets to reunite with the Sakai clan again. It helps Shinano realize, however, that he took the kindness of his current family and Saniwa for granted. When he returns, he's still as spoiled and clingy as before, but he stops acting like an entitled kid.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Kobayashi Yuusuke]]. Artist is [[Kunimitsu (9nimi2)|]].

title: surprised_pikachu_(meme)
body:
[b]Surprised Pikachu[/b], also known as Shocked Pikachu, refers to a screenshot from the [[Pokemon_(anime)|Pokémon]] anime of the character [[Pikachu]] with its mouth agape, as though it were surprised at something. In the autumn of 2018, the image was used as a reaction image paired with captions where a set-up leads to a predictable outcome that nevertheless leaves one surprised.

Surprised Pikachu automatically gives an example of :o

title: what
body:
"[i]What.[/i]":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlatWhat

Posts that you do not understand at all and leave you thinking, "What the hell?" This tag is for things that transcend fetishes and leave [i]everyone[/i] stupefied.  Often if not always with some degree of surrealism.

Very [b][[tag_group:subjective|subjective]][/b] tag. [b]DO NOT[/b] flood this tag or apply it to random [[guro]]/[[bondage]] posts.

[quote]User [b]Hillside Moose[/b]: 
"Does it make your brain shut down for a minute the moment you see it?"
[/quote]

title: p-40_warhawk
body:
Built by Curtiss and flown by every Allied country with an air force, the [b]P-40 Warhawk[/b] is one of the most iconic and influential American aircraft ever produced, for both engineering and cultural reasons.

Despite being inferior in speed and altitude performance to most frontline aircraft when the United States entered [[WWII]], the P-40 was famous for punching above its weight. The P-40 was tough, easy to fly and could outdive fighters six years newer and fifteen thousand dollars more expensive - strengths that were exploited by the famous "Flying Tigers", who exclusively flew P-40s. 

But much more importantly the P-40 was culturally influential. Those Flying Tigers became an important propaganda tool for the United States, and the shark-teeth warpaint that adorned their P-40s had been copied an innumerable amount of times on any aircraft on any country- including, ironically, Japan.

title: j7w_shinden
body:
The [b]Kyushu J7W Shinden[/b] (震電, "Magnificent Lightning") was a land-based interceptor developed during [[World War II]] by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] to defend against bombing raids by the [[B-29 Superfortress]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #990309.[/tn]

Only two prototypes were built and the first flight was not until August 3, 1945, less than two weeks before the Japanese surrender. One of the the prototypes was scrapped after the war and the other is preserved in the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.

Despite having played no role in the war, the Shinden's distinctive appearance (with a rear-mounted "pusher" propeller, rear-mounted wings and [[canards]]) and the fact that it was Imperial Japan's most technologically advanced piston aircraft have given it an enduring popularity.

h4. See also
* [[List of airplanes]]
* "Wikipedia: Kyushu J7W":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyushu_J7W_Shinden]
* Kancolle Wiki: "Shinden (Magnificent Lightning) Kai":http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Shinden_%28Magnificent_Lightning%29_Kai (a fictional carrier-based variant)
** [[Shinden (Kancolle)]] (its [[fairy (kancolle)|]] pilot)

title: gaybar_pose_(meme)
body:
Famous attack move done by [[Danny Lee]] in original [[Gachimuchi]] videos. In this scene, Danny grabs both of [[Billy Herrington]]'s arms, pressing one of his knees on Billy's back, stretching his arms and shouts [b]"Give up!"[/b], which was widely misheard as "Gaybar".

This pose went viral in Japanese communities along with Gachimuchi communities which later spread outside Japan.

title: hizamaru_(touken_ranbu)
body:
Personification of the [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] ''Usu-midori'', treasure of the Minamoto Clan. The name used for [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] is one of many that the sword had obtained over the years, ''Hizamaru'' in particular referencing a practice test where the sword cut through the knees of an opponent. 

The game portrays him as the younger brother/ younger brother figure of fellow Minamoto clan sword [[higekiri_(touken_ranbu)|Higekiri]], and is highly affectionate towards him though the historical Higekiri was used to cut Usu-midori (thus earning the name ''Tomokiri'', "Friend Cutter"). This is because of the relationship between their owners; Hizamaru's owner Minamoto no Yoshitsune had his brother Yoritomo, owner of Higekiri, in high regard. He also frets about becoming "separated" from his brother again, as seen in his citadel, pre-battle quote and sword breaking dialogue.

Has [[green hair]] swept over [[hair_over_one_eye| to the right side]] and [[yellow eyes]], and wears a [[military uniform]] with [[black gloves]]. He also has rather prominent [[fangs]] when he opens his mouth.


Shares a character designer with Higekiri in [[shirano]].

title: higekiri_(touken_ranbu)
body:
A [[tachi (weapon)|Tachi-class sword]]. Treasure of the Minamoto/Genji Clan, obtaining its name from a  test beheading where the sword cleanly cut through a criminal's beard along with the neck. Currently stored in Kitano Tenmangu Temple in Kyoto. 

In [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i], the sword is treated as the elder brother of [[hizamaru_(touken_ranbu)|Hizamaru]], another Minamoto clan Sword, though he's constantly forgetting Hizamaru's name. This may be a reference to the fact that both Hizamaru and Higekiri have had many different names throughout history. Fan works like to exaggerate this trait to the point of being a running gag, as Higekiri is bad with other names, as well.

He's portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[yellow eyes]], and wears a white jacket [[jacket_on_shoulders|around his shoulders]]. Has black [[half gloves]].

[i]Seiyuu[/i] is [[Hanae Natsuki]]. Character designer is [[shirano]].

body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #556 in the National PokéDex, a Grass type Pokémon.
Maractus is a cactus-like Pokémon, with large ear-like extensions. These extensions feature dark green spiky arrangements at the base, yellow spikes further up, and flowers, with pink petals and yellow centers, at the top. It has a yellow spike on its head, yellow eyes and a spiky-looking mouth. 

Japanese Name: [b]Maracacchi[/b]

title: bob_ross
body:
[b]Bob Norman Ross[/b] (October 29, 1942 – July 4, 1995) was an American painter and television host who died of lymphoma at the age of 52.

With his calm, patient nature, Ross came to prominence as the creator and host of [i]The Joy of Painting[/i], a long-running television program on public broadcast stations in the United States. His [[afro]] styled hair was a delight to many fans.

title: steve_irwin
body:
[b]Stephen Robert Irwin[/b] (22 February 1962 – 4 September 2006), nicknamed the "Crocodile Hunter" was an Australian zookeeper and television personality.

Irwin became prominent as the titular host of the 1996 wildlife television series "[i]The Crocodile Hunter[/i]."

Irwin died in Batt Reef on September 2006 after being repeatedly stabbed by a [[stingray|smooth stingray]] in the chest, resulting in his heart being pierced by the stingray's barb. Irwin was supposed to be filming for his final documentary [i]Ocean's Deadliest[/i].

h4.External links
"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Irwin]
other_names: スティーブ・アーウィン

title: roland_tr-808
body: The [b]Roland TR-808 Rhythm Composer[/b] is an analog synthesis [[drum machine]] manufactured by Roland Corporation. Though only in production from 1980 to 1983 an considered a commercial failure by its manufacturer, the TR-808 achieved a cult following and became the iconic drum machine of the later 1980s and beyond, particularly in the electronica and hip-hop genres.

title: gee_bill!_(meme)
body:
Parody images of the [i]Skinless[/i] hotdogs advertisement, published in September of 1942 from [i]Woman's Day[/i] magazine.

Depicts two characters, one with one thing, and the other with two of that thing. The former asking the latter something similar to "Gee [x]! How come [y] lets you have [u]two[/u] [z]s?"

h4. Know Your Meme entry
* https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/gee-bill-how-come-your-mom-lets-you-eat-two-wieners

title: survivor_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|stand]] in [[Stone Ocean]]. Described as the weakest Stand by [[dio brando|DIO]], with its sole ability being to transfer small electric shocks to people in order to make them irrationally angry.

Two possible namesakes are American rock band Survivor (active 1978-1988, 1993-present) and their eponymous debut studio album, released in February 1980.

title: blue-eyes_white_dragon
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 8
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon
[i]This legendary [[dragon]] is a powerful engine of destruction.
Virtually invincible, very few have faced this awesome creature and lived to tell the tale.[/i]
[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2500

The iconic [[Duel Monster]] of [[Kaiba Seto]] from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] manga, anime and collectible card game. Its signature move is "Burst Stream of Destruction" (滅びの爆裂疾風弾:Horobi no Burst Stream) ("White Lightning" in the English dub).

title: fumi-chan_(tawawa)
body: The pet cat of [[senpai (tawawa)|Senpai]] from [[Getsuyoubi no Tawawa]], first appearing in the anime adaptation before eventually making its debut in the Twitter webcomic. It was given its name by [[kouhai-chan (tawawa)|Kouhai-chan]], because when she first picked it up, it kneaded (in Japanese: 踏み踏みしてきた, or [i]fumifumi-shitekita[/i]) her breasts.

title: diablo_(isekai_maou)
body:
The main protagonist of [i][[Isekai Maou to Shoukan Shoujo no Dorei Majutsu]][/i].

In his previous life, he is known as [b]Takuma Sakamoto[/b], also known by his username of "[nodtext]@Diablo-13[/nodtext]". Later on, Takuma became the very character he was playing in an MMORPG named "Cross Reverie" after reincarnating in the video game's world.

Portrayed as a highly confident, insolent demon lord with charismatic aura, but in truth, is an introvert and rather nervous man.

title: nurburgring
body: A race track in Germany. Known as the "Green Hell" due to its brutal difficulty. Also, infamously hated by former [[Top Gear]] host [[James May]].

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#ga.ga:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]ga[/td]
[td]ガ[/td]
[td]が[/td]
[td](1) *impact*;
(2) *grab*;
(3) *pow* *bang*[/td]
[td](3) As if shot from a gun[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ga[/td]
[td]ガッ[/td]
[td]がっ[/td]
[td](1) *impact* *crunch*;
(2) *punch* *hit* *strike*;
(3) *clang* *crash* *clank*;
(4) *thud* *lands*;
(5) *snap*[/td]
[td](2) Fighting SFX;
(3) SFX for metal-on-metal impact, like two swords banging against one another in a fight;
(5) Like the snap of jaws or teeth, usually in anger or with enthusiasm[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ga ga[/td]
[td]ガガ[/td]
[td]がが[/td]
[td](1) *grab grab*;
(2) *clack clack*;
(3) *munch crunch* *munch munch*[/td]
[td](2) A very traditional way of brushing rice from a bowl into one's mouth using a pair of chopsticks, hence the "clack clack" sound of the chopsticks hitting the bowl.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ga ga[/td]
[td]ガッ ガッ[/td]
[td]がっ がっ[/td]
[td]*bish bash*
*wham bam*[/td]
[td]SFX for crashing or smashing with force, often used in a fight.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ga-[/td]
[td]ガー[/td]
[td]がー[/td]
[td](1) gaaaahh;
(2) *quack*;
(3) *mystical*;
(4) *whirl*[/td]
[td](1) Usually to explain sounds of large machines at work.  Ex. vacuum cleaners.  Or when a person is emotionally built up about something;
(2) Sound of a duck;
(3) A mystical sound;
(4) SFX for the movement of something mechanical, like that of a robot.[/td]
[/tr]

[td]ga- go-[/td]
[td]ガーゴー[/td]

[td]がーん[/td]
[td](1) *shock*;
(2) *gooongg*;
(3) *gloom*[/td]
[td](2) Sound of a gong;

[/tr]

[td]ガバ[/td]
[td]がば[/td]
[td](1) *grabs* *glomps*;

(4) *rising*;

[tr]

[td]がびん[/td]
[td]*freeze* *shock*[/td]

title: doushite-chan
body:
A character appearing in many of [[Pinocchio-P]]'s music videos.
Like [[Aimaina]], she's a [[chibi]] version (or perhaps a hand puppet?) of [[Hatsune Miku]], only this time with [[pink hair]], blood trailing from her mouth, and [[black eyes]].

Is usually seen bloody or holding a knife.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: aimaina
body:
A character appearing in many of [[Pinocchio-P]]'s music videos, including one that shares [[aimaina_(vocaloid)|her name]].
She's a chibi version of [[Hatsune Miku]] (or a doll, perhaps?), without a mouth and with [[red eyes]].

Sometimes accompanied by [[Doushite-chan]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: souffle_pancake
body:
A Japanese [[pancake]] variant, characterized by being much thicker, fluffier and airier. They’re made using the same ingredients as regular pancakes, but with less flour, with the egg whites beaten into a meringue and using a folding technique just like [[souffle (food)| souffle]], hence the name. They can be made in a mold, which results in a [[cake]]-like shape and more compressed structure.

h4. See also

* [[pancake stack]] 
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: control_bar
body:
Typically depicted as a wooden cross, used to control the puppet strings attached to a marionette.

h4. See also
* [[marionette]]
* [[puppet]]
* [[puppet rings]]
* [[puppet strings]]

title: puppet
body:
A [[doll]] of cloth or wood, which can be operated by a puppeteer by means of strings and cable or by wearing it as a glove.

If it's controlled with [[puppet strings]], it's a [[marionette]].

Some puppets have proper names like [[Shanghai Doll]] or [[Pinocchio (character)|]].

h4. See also

* [[hand puppet]]
* [[finger puppet]]
* [[shadow puppet]]
* [[puppet rings]] (usually used together with puppet strings)
* [[control bar]]
* [[puppet show]]
* [[karakuri puppet]] (kind of like a wooden [[steampunk]] robot)

title: puppet_rings
body:
[[Ring]]s used to control and manipulate [[puppet]]s.

Typically drawn as one or more (but most commonly, a full set) of metal bands or rings on a person's fingers. [[Puppet strings]] are often attached to these rings, but not always directly or visibly. 

These may also appear [i]as[/i] or [i]in conjunction with[/i] [[fingerless gloves]] (post #1127458, for example), but still qualify for this tag.

Most commonly appears in images featuring [[Alice Margatroid]].

h4. See also
* [[control bar]]
* [[puppet strings]]
* [[Shanghai doll]]

title: elza_walker
body:
The in-development name of the female protagonist in the cancelled "BIOHAZARD 1.5", her design was reworked into [[Claire Redfield]] in the final build of [[Resident Evil 2]].
Her alternate development name was Rachel Speyer (レイチェル・スパイヤー).

A 20-year-old figure skater from [[Thailand]], and a good friend of [[Katsuki Yuuri]]. His coach is [[Celestino Cialdini]]. He loves posting on social media and often takes [[selfie|selfies]] with his [[smartphone]].

title: hiroshima_peace_memorial
body: Hiroshima Peace Memorial, commonly called the Atomic Bomb Dome or A-Bomb Dome (原爆ドーム Genbaku Dōmu), in [[Hiroshima]], Japan, is part of the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1996. The ruin serves as a memorial to the people who were killed in the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|atomic bombing of Hiroshima]] on August 6, 1945.

title: hokuto_ujou_koushou_ha
body:
Lit. North Star Humanist Rising Bird Wave 

The power-up version of [[toki_(hokuto_no_ken)|Toki]]'s [[Hokuto Ujou Hagan Ken]], appeared in Koei's [[Hokuto Musou]], aka. Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage. 

Due to its strong similarity with [[Wing Gundam Zero]]'s beam attack in the [[Super Robot Wars]] series, it is frequently called [b]Hokuto Ujou Rolling Buster Rifle[/b]. 

h4.See also 

* [[Hokuto Ujou Hagan Ken]] 
* [[Hokuto Musou]] 
* [[Toki (hokuto no ken)]] 
* [[Hokuto no Ken]]

body:
Fish-Flavored Toast is a special food item that the player has a chance to obtain by cooking Fisherman's Toast with Klee. 

Fishy Toast was renamed to Fish-Flavored Toast in version 1.2 update.

https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Fish-Flavored_Toast

title: gnosis_(genshin_impact)
body: The Vision of Archons, looks like chess pieces

title: waverider_(genshin_impact)
body:
A watercraft in [[genshin_impact|Genshin Impact]].

A small [[boat]] the player can use to navigate bodies of water. It has an interior cabin, a [[lantern]] hanging from its back to the side, and three small flags are hung from the back of the cabin. The roof of the boat's cabin is mostly white with some gold patterns.

title: sanae-chan
body:
[i]A friend of Rie-chan.
She sings very well, and often goes to sing karaoke with her on her off days.
She's been taking guitar classes lately![/i]

A Japanese girl who is a friend of [[Rie-chan]]. They work in the same [[cafe]] together. She used to work in a general goods where she earned enough money to buy a [[guitar]]. Now she takes guitar lessons from Sugi-kun; she also takes [[knitting]] lessons from Oliva. 

Hates smokers and tobacco in general.

title: pizza_hut
body:
A popular American franchise of [[pizza]] restaurants. The franchise was founded on 1958 by the Carney brothers, Dan Carney and his late younger brother, Frank Carney.

It was prominently featured in the anime [i][[Code Geass]][/i] as part of [[product placement]] and in [i][[Genshin Impact]][/i] during a collaboration event in the China branch.

h4. See also

* [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]
* [[Code Geass]]
* [[Cheese-kun]]

body:

Official website: <https://www.b-boy.jp/special/lalakon/>
English version: <https://medibang.itch.io/lalas-married-life>

title: ceiling_fan
body: A fan suspended from or mounted directly to the [[ceiling]]. Ceiling fans are almost always powered by electric motors, but images of ceiling fans shouldn't be tagged [[electric fan]] unless there is a corded or battery-powered fan present.

title: three_as_one
body: [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] song '"Three of Me, One of Someone Else":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dxKr446vMXM]' by Shiro Sagisu, referring to [[Ayanami Rei]]'s three incarnations from the original anime continuation, known as 'Rei I', 'Rei II' and 'Rei III', [spoiler]and Rei's being a clone of [[Ikari Yui]],[/spoiler] while also referencing Eric Berne's transactional analysis and the PAC ego-states of Parent, Adult (self) and Child.

title: dead_sea_scrolls
body: Ancient Jewish and Hebrew religious manuscripts discovered between 1946 and 1956, including the oldest surviving manuscripts of some parts of [[the Bible|the Tanakh]].

title: tamaki_(mechanic)_(princess_connect!)
body:
[[Tamaki (princess connect!)|]]'s [[official alternate costume|official]] mechanic costume in [[Princess Connect!]].

She is a [[catgirl]] who has [[purple eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[gradient hair]] that is [[purple hair|purple]] (sometimes [[pink hair|pink]] & [[white hair|white]] with [[bangs]]. As well as [[cat ears]] with [[animal ear fluff]] & [[two tails|two]] [[cat tail]]s. She wears a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[crop top]], [[purple skirt|purple]] [[miniskirt]], a [[black choker]] with a [[neck bell ]], [[purple headwear|purple]] [[visor cap]], [[utility belt]], [[backpack]], and a [[megaphone]], and an [[armlet]].

h4. See Also

* "Mechanic Tamaki":[https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Tamaki_(Mechanic)]

title: natsuzora
body:
"Natsuzora":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natsuzora] (なつぞら) is a Japanese television drama series aired in 2019 as part of Asadora (朝ドラ, "Morning Drama") TV block on NHK. All of the asadora storylines center on the life of a female heroine who faces challenges while working to achieve her dreams. Natsuzora is loosely based on the life of animator "Reiko Okuyama":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Okuyama].

The story is set during the high economic development time of the Showa period. [[okuhara_natsu|Natsu]] lost her parents during the war so she moves to the Tokachi region in Hokkaido with her foster father who is a dairy farmer. While growing up, Natsu meets a boy at primary school who draws a very beautiful picture of a horse so she becomes interested in animated movies. Upon graduating from senior high school, Natsu moves to Tokyo and joins the budding animation industry in order to fulfill her dream of becoming an animator.

title: nitori_day
body:
February 10th is [[Kawashiro Nitori]] Day, one of [[Touhou|Touhou Project]] date tags. Since February 10th can be read as "2 (ni) 10 (to)" it's a day when artists draw and post artworks with Nitori.

For those who missed February 10th, there is also a tag called "February 11th is the day for those who missed Nitori Day."
other_names: 2月11日はにとりの日に間に合わなかった人の日

title: mahou_yuugi
body: Magical Play (魔法遊戯 飛び出す!! ハナマル大冒険, Mahō Yūgi Tobidasu!! Hanamaru Daibōken) is a Japanese original net animation directed by Hiroki Hayashi featuring character designs by Kiyohiko Azuma. It was webcast from November 16, 2001 to May 3, 2002, totaling twenty-four episodes. The magical girl satire was later compiled into four half-hour episodes and released on four DVDs. A 3D OVA episode was released on December 29, 2001
other_names: 魔法遊戯飛び出す!!ハナマル大冒険

title: aoi_shouko

[i]I smile while looking at the mirror every day in order to make myself obedient.
Someday, I will be able to smile honestly...[/i]

Has [[player 2]] skins that can make her look like [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]] and [[Fujisaki Shiori]].

body:
[i] The self-proclaimed "king of music".
Actually, both his singing and dancing are top-notch, and he's a longed-for idol by teens all over the world.
Despite the flashy appearance, he seems to be pretty friendly with moms and dads.[/i]

A loud [[United States|American]] who is the "King of Music." Loves [[American football| football]], [[boxing]], and trying new things with his music. Friend of [[Mary (pop'n music)|]] though he hates the [[nattou]] she keeps trying to make him eat.

Is of course inspired by the King of Rock n' Roll [[Elvis Presley]]

title: kala_ideas
body:
An [i][[Atelier Ryza 3]][/i] character. 

She is a new character debuting in [i]Atelier Ryza 3[/i]. Due to the game being repeatedly delayed to late February/early March 2023, her first appearance ended up on the [i]Atelier[/i] franchise collaboration event with [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #5848502 for Azur Lane version.[/tn]

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[white skin|pale skin]], [[heterochromia]] ([[grey eyes|grey]] on right, [[yellow eyes|yellow]] on left), and an [[antlers|antler]] [[tiara]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress]], white [[pantyhose]], and an outer layer [[white dress]].

title: futaba_anzu
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. A lazy, short (139 cm or 4'7"), 17-year-old [[NEET]], she often wears a white [[t-shirt]] with "[[you work you lose|You Lose If You Work]]" on the front and can be seen with a tattered [[stuffed rabbit]].

She believes she will be able to become rich and live off her earnings as an idol. Her aloof and uncooperative attitude remains unchanged even after training. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the first CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shibuya Rin]], [[Mimura Kanako]], [[Takagaki Kaede]] and [[Jougasaki Rika]]. Her seiyuu is [[Igarashi Hiromi]].

She is in the unit "Ankira" with [[Moroboshi Kirari]], as well as "[[CANDY ISLAND (idolmaster)|]]" with [[Mimura Kanako]] and [[Ogata Chieri]].

[[Original]] character by [[Kotoba Noriaki]].

A haunted [[eyepatch]] worn by a [[stuffed rabbit]] carried by [[hinomaru_(kotoba)|Hinomaru]].

title: midori_(kancolle)
body:
A member of the [[Rashinban Musume]], or compass girls of [[Kantai Collection]].  

Her defining features are her [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]] and an [[ahoge]].  She usually carries or has a [[stuffed rabbit]] nearby. She typically wears a dark gray and black [[serafuku]] with white [[pantyhose]].

She often has a sleepy expression on her face, or is shown outright [[sleeping]].

title: gundam_side_story:_missing_link
body:
[b][i]Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: Missing Link[/i][/b] is an online multiplayer [[mecha]] combat [[video game]] set in the Universal Century that is available on the [[PlayStation 3]] platform. 

The game was developed by B.B. Studio and published by [[Namco]] [[Bandai]] Games in 2014. It is still active and follows spinoff stories and missions tied to [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]].

body: Li Lianjie, better known by his stage name Jet Li, is a Chinese film actor, film producer, martial artist, and retired Wushu champion.

title: jackie_chan
body:
Hong Kong's cheeky, lovable and best known film star, Jackie Chan endured many years of long, hard work and multiple injuries to establish international success via his early beginnings in Hong Kong's manic [[martial arts]] cinema industry.

Jackie was born Kong-sang Chan on Hong Kong's famous Victoria Peak on April 7, 1954, to Charles and Lee-Lee Chan, and the family emigrated to Canberra, Australia, in early 1960. The young Jackie was less than successful scholastically, so his father sent him back to Hong Kong to attend the rigorous China Drama Academy, one of the Peking Opera schools.
(Source: Imdb.com)

h4. See also
* [[Jet Li]]
* [[Bruce Lee]]
* [[Jackie Chan Adventures]]

title: li_wenwen
body:

title: sun_yiwen
body:
A Chinese women's left-handed [[epee|épée]] [[fencing|fencer]]. She is a two-time Olympian, she is a [[2016 summer olympics|2016]] team Olympic silver medalist, 2016 individual Olympic bronze medalist, and [[2020 summer olympics|2021]] individual Olympic champion. In Tokyo, She became the first Chinese fencer in history to win an Olympic gold medal in individual women's épée.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Yiwen]

body: Originated in 2018 from a [[4chan]] "thread on the literature board, /lit/":https://archived.moe/lit/thread/12124665/#12124717 presenting "a photo of a man refueling a car":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/dc/50/dc50e87496dc8479d3d922673e8baad5.png] with the request "write a short story about this image". title: katalina_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Katalina Aryze (カタリナ・アリゼ [i]Katarina Arize[/i]) is a playable SR [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character.

She is one of the main characters and is the first character to be attained by the player.

She has long brown hair and brown eyes (though her sprite depicts her eyes as red). She wears earrings and standard silver and blue armour along with a cape and many [[belt skirt]]s. Catalina herself is very righteous and the sworn protector of [[lyria (granblue fantasy)|Lyria]].

See [[male warrior (disgaea)]] for the male version.

title: bumblebee_(film)
body:
The sixth live-action [[Transformers]] film, and a continuity reboot to the series. It was originally planned to be a prequel movie connected with [[transformers (live action)|Michael Bay's Transformer movies]] but it was later changed to be a reboot due to consistently negative fan reception to the Bay movies.

Directed by Travis Knight and starring Hailee Steinfeld and [[John Cena]], the 2018 movie follows [[Bumblebee (transformers)|]] after he escapes from the Decepticons and lands on Earth during the 1980s, where he befriends a young punk girl named [[Charlie Watson]]. The movie received positive reviews by fans and critics due to its story, characters and usage of G1-inspired designs for the robots.

A sequel, titled [b][[Transformers: Rise of the Beasts]][/b], was announced for a June 2023 release, introducing elements of [[Beast Wars]]  into the films.

title: kiss_players
body:
A 2006 installment in the [[Transformers]] franchise consisting of a manga, toyline, and radio drama. The series is named for the female human characters who have the ability to fuse with Cybertronians by kissing them. Each release in the toyline included both a transformer and a figure of their human companion.

The series is viewed with disdain by many western fans due to it's usage of sexually suggestive imagery and scenes where the young-looking female characters are placed in questionable scenarios involving Transformers. It is also notable for retconning several spinoffs and standalone series (including [i][[Transformers Car Robots|Car Robots]][/i]) into the Japanese G1 continuity.

title: the_dirty_pair_(comic)
body: An officially licensed manga-style American comic series based on the [[Dirty Pair]] franchise. It is comprised of several short miniseries, each released as a collected volume. The entire series is illustrated by [[Adam Warren]].

title: dirty_pair
body:
A [[science fiction]] franchise based on a series of novels by Takachiho Haruka. The series follows [[Kei (dirty pair)|]] and [[Yuri (dirty pair)|]], a pair of WWWA agents who solve crimes and complete various other jobs they are given while causing massive collateral damage along the way. The franchise has multiple different entries, many of which are in separate continuities.

The most recognizable version of the main duo is from the 80s anime adaptation, where they were designed by [[Dokite Tsukasa]] and featured in a TV series, an OVA series, a theatrical film, and several OVA films.

h4. Other Versions
* [[Dirty Pair (novels)|The novels]], the source material for the franchise, illustrated by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]].
* [[Dirty Pair Flash]], a 90s reboot featuring a younger version of the pair in a new continuity with character designs by [[Kimura Takahiro]].
* [[Dirty Pair no Daibouken]], a 2012 manga that shares its name with the first volume of the original novels, illustrated by [[Tamaki Hisao]].
* [[The Dirty Pair (comic)|]], a series of officially licensed comics published by Eclipse Comics and Dark Horse Comics, written and illustrated by [[Adam Warren]].


h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirty_Pair]
* "Wikipedia (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%80%E3%83%BC%E3%83%86%E3%82%A3%E3%83%9A%E3%82%A2]

title: kincsem_(racehorse)
body:
<tn>Hungarian: "My treasure", "My darling"</tn>

Real-life Hungarian racehorse from the late 19th century, she has by far the longest undefeated race record of any racehorse, being undefeated in all of her 54 races (second best record is 25 races by Black Caviar).

She was a chestnut (or liver chestnut) mare with no markings, often described as ugly and noted to have a quirky personality. She was also something of a living legend figure, thus much of her life story should be taken with a grain of salt.

Although she had few foals, her mare-line survives in modern times through both of her surviving fillies. One of the most notable modern day descendant of hers is Camelot, who challenged the British Triple Crown.

title: mobius_1
body:
"Amidst the blue skies, a link from past to future. The sheltering wings of the protector... The flames of hatred scorched the skies... Igniting Gaia's funeral pyre."

Protagonist and player character of the game [[Ace Combat 04]]. Lead pilot of the Mobius squadron, part of the [[isaf|I.S.A.F.]] Air Force, and flies an [[F-22 Raptor]].

Not much is known about the past or future of Mobius 1. Throughout the game he seems to be the only member of his squadron, alongside his AWACS codenamed Sky Eye, which doesn't seem to faze him at all as he nearly singlehandedly puts Erusea to their knees with an almost inhuman combat performance. 

[spoiler]However his surviving allies from previous missions join the squadron for the final mission against the Megalith facility.[/spoiler]

The callsign "Mobius" comes from the [[mobius strip]], a 3-dimensional shape which only has one side. It is commonly referred to the real-world representation of the word "infinity."
A möbius strip makes up the major part of the squadron insignia (post #717018).

In 2023, the Chinese Balloon incident suddenly became a trend and referenced the 13th Mission known as "Safe Return" where Mobius 1 shot down the Jamming Airships throughout the mountains while escorting a spy plane.

h4.See also

* "Acepedia article":http://acecombat.wikia.com/wiki/Mobius_1
* [[Ace Combat 04]]
* [[Yellow 4]]

title: berserk_ryuuko
body: First appearing in Episode 12 of [[Kill la Kill]], it is a monstrous form that Ryuuko and Senketsu mutate into during their fight against [[Harime Nui]], caused by Ryuuko's blood boiling to an unsafe level from sheer rage. This form is most notable for its warped, zombified twist on Ryuuko's normal appearance: [[Scissor Blade (kill La Kill)|]] half-attached to the right arm; a gigantic, armored, bloody left arm; Senketsu's eye constricted and bloodshot; boiling blood spouting randomly; and a pair of huge, sharp maws on the head and waist. Both Senketsu and Ryuuko also seem to groan from constant pain caused by this transformation.

title: scissor_blade_(kill_la_kill)
body:
[[Matoi Ryuuko]]'s primary weapon in [[Kill la Kill]]. She wields one half of a red pair of scissors capable of cutting apart Goku Uniforms. The Scissor Blade can shrink into a regular-sized scissor half, or morph itself via mechanical joints into a much larger version that Ryuuko uses to fight, which she calls Decapitation Mode.

The other half is with the person responsible for murdering Ryuuko's father. She battles [[Kiryuuin Satsuki]] and her minions to find out who owns the missing Scissor Blade.

[spoiler]In episode 12, [[Harime Nui]] reveals that she owns the other half of the Scissor Blade and that she murdered Ryuuko's father on [[Kiryuuin Ragyou]]'s orders. For some reason, Nui's half is colored purple until Ryuuko recovers it and reattaches it to her own half.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Kill la Kill Wiki: Scissor Blades":[https://kill-la-kill.fandom.com/wiki/Scissor_Blades]

title: ferrari_f40
body: The [b]Ferrari F40[/b] is an Italian sports car introduced in 1987 to celebrate Ferrari's 40th anniversary--even though the company was founded in 1939. The F40 was very expensive by the standards of the day ($400,000 MSRP in the US) and was one of the main competitors to the [[Lamborghini Countach]]. It also has the distinction of being the last car personally approved by company founder Enzo Ferrari before his death in 1988. Road-legal F40s were made from 1987 to 1992, with racing-only versions persisting until 1996.

title: rune_of_death
body:
The Rune of Death, also known as Destined Death, is a rune sealed by [[Queen Marika the Eternal]] to create the Golden Order.


"The Rune of Death goes by two names, the other is Destined Death. The forbidden shadow, plucked from the Golden Order upon its creation..." - [[Finger Reader Enia]]

title: tomoko_(sora_no_otoshimono)
body: Female version of [[Sakurai Tomoki]] from [[Sora no Otoshimono]].
